alert.note: Alert for Hamblen; Northwest Cocke; Northwest Greene (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 4:57PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Cocke, southwestern Greene and southeastern Hamblen Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of White Pine, or 8 miles southeast of Morristown, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Newport, Parrottsville, Mosheim, Caney Branch, Bybee, Lowland and Mohawk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
